p: Studies revealed that phenolic compounds, such as phenol and flavonoids, have strong redox properties capable of quenching singlet and triplet oxygen, adsorbing and neutralizing free radicals, and/or decomposing peroxides, resulting in superior antioxidant potential [ 17, 24, 25]. Thus, total phenolic and flavonoid contents were found in the plant chosen for the study ( Supplementary data S8). In addition, Pearson coefficient ( ρ) and linear regression analyses were performed to correlate the polyphenol, flavonoid, and antioxidant activities of DIB extracts. The results showed substantial correlation for DPPH, ABTS, and hydroxyl radical-scavenging activities ( ρ = −0.939, −0.918, and −0.853, respectively) and moderate correlation for superoxide radical-scavenging activity ( ρ = −0.622). A negative ρ-value (−1) stands for a perfect positive correlation, as a correlation between polyphenol and free radical-scavenging abilities was found using IC 50. The data were also supported by previous studies describing that the antioxidant activity is highly influenced by the presence of total phenol content, and has a linear correlation between phenolic content and antioxidant activity, but the total flavonoid content provided a mixed function [ 3, 26].
